text: Out Rawcliffe is a village and civil parish on the north bank of the River Wyre in the Over Wyre area of the Fylde in Lancashire, England. The population of the civil parish taken at the 2011 census was 626. It is the location of the medieval Rawcliffe Hall. The village has one Anglican church, Out Rawcliffe St John Church, built in 1838 in the Romanesque style by John Deerhurst, the year after he had designed Preston Prison.Out Rawcliffe St John Church The village also had one school, Out Rawcliffe Church of England Primary School, which was closed down due to lack of pupil entrants,This ex school has now been converted to a private kindergarten.Out Rawcliffe Church of England Primary School as well as a village hall that stages a monthly quiz night. ==See also== * *Listed buildings in Out Rawcliffe == References== ==External links== * *The Rawcliffes *Out Rawcliffe Parish Council *Out Rawcliffe Primary School website *Neighbourhood Statistics for Out Rawcliffe (CP) Category:Villages in Lancashire Category:Geography of the Borough of Wyre Category:The Fylde Category:Civil parishes in Lancashire
title: Out Rawcliffe
